Happy new year to you, your family, and your community! As we close out 2019 – and the past decade – we take a moment to reflect on those things that have happened, and the things to come. First of all, I am grateful for my faith and my family. If you had told us 10 years ago that we’d be involved in politics, and working with the President to pass a massive new trade deal, I would have laughed. Yet, here we are. Many of you have heard me quote the Book of Esther, where the Old Testament says you are where you are “for a time such as this.” I believe with all my heart that we have been called to serve. It has been an honor. In 2019, our family got to witness the marriage of my oldest son, Victor, and welcome his bride Chrissy into the family. Our children and grandchildren continue to navigate life, and our parents, brothers, sisters and their families continue to have reasonably good health, and like my grandma always said, “if you have your health, you have everything.” 2019 was a huge year for our country and our state. President Trump continued delivering results for the American people, most recently with both the USMCA and a Phase One trade deal with China. Our economy continued its amazing turnaround to the strongest economy of my professional life, with unemployment falling to historic lows and wages rising to new heights. In fact, the average hard-working American family has $7,000 more in 2019 than they did 4 years ago! Democrats, on the other hand, continued their obsession with obstructing our President at every turn. Now, they’ve weaponized the impeachment process because they can’t get over losing one election and they’re afraid of losing another in 2020. Not only that, the Democrat Party has continued its march to the radical Left, openly embracing a socialist agenda that would transform what has made America great. 2019 was also big for our family in that it was the year that Laina and I made the decision that it was time to run for the United States Senate. The support we’ve been shown over the last several months has been humbling. I made the decision to run for one simple reason: I want to leave Kansas – the state where I was born and raised, and the state where I raised my family – better than I found it. I want to leave this country better than I found it. I want our kids and grandkids to have the same shot at the American dream that I’ve had. This campaign is about the state I was born and raised, and raised my children – the state I love. It’s about the future we want for Kansas, and for all of America. Our future will be defined by what happens in 2020. Every election seems like it’s “the most important ever,” but never before have socialists gained such a vocal foothold in our country, and to keep this republic, we will all have to stand tall. No one said it would be easy. This is the time for a generation of Americans to stand up and fight back. 🔘 In 2020, we must continue to stand strong and lead against the Left’s impeachment sham and support President Trump’s agenda. 🔘In 2020, we must continue to call out and fight the Left’s embrace of radical socialism. 🔘In 2020, we must continue to stand for life, for our jobs, our farmers, our ranchers, our workers, our businesses, and the Kansas values we hold dear. Kansans stick together. We win together. We are a team, united for our families, our communities, and our future. If we are going to leave our state and nation better than we found it, it’s going to take all of us working together. Laina and I are ready for what’s ahead. I hope you’ll join us.
